main event: Two star-like objects were observed in Windham Center, Connecticut, on July 17, 1956.
interesting points: Objects emitted a deep throbbing sound and left vapor trails,Objects appeared pea-sized and bright like a star,Observers thought the objects were meteors until one exploded,One object vanished after a possible collision,The observation lasted for approximately 15 minutes.
witness description: The witness is identified as a student.
